subject: Steroids
Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The N.H.L. is trying to fool the public with a flawed anti-doping program, Dick Pound, the chairman of the World Anti-Doping agency, said yesterday. Pound said statements made by the league Monday that there were no positive tests among the 1,406 that were administered during the season were meaningless given the loopholes in its program. He said the N.H.L. does not test for stimulants and other banned substances.
